reviews.text: The St. Regis Singapore is clearly a five-star hotel, but my wife and I found it to be short on charm and long on "bling". While we enjoyed our stay and the hotel is in a great location right off Orchard Road, we would probably not return.
reviews.title: Five-star, but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few of the minor disappointments (these are admittedly minor, but you expect perfection in a five-star St. Regis) included: a) very slow service in the bar during the evening -- we waited 10-15 minutes for menu; b) when we went down to enjoy the complementary breakfast buffet the room was full and we were sent to the "overflow" restaurant poolside (which ended up being nice enought) and c) the room decor was a bit dated and very "bling" -- lots of fake, shiny lacquer. When you factor in the price, we will try another hotel on our next trip to Singapore
reviews.title: Simply Superb in every way - cant wait to go back!

reviews.text: Our first experience of a St Regis Hotel and wow did they deliver. We spent two nights here on our way home to Australia after being overseas for almost nine weeks. We had booked a Lady Astore Suite and alerted the hotel that our flight got in from LA at approximatley 5.45am. Whilst we did not expect to have our room ready we certainly did not expect the service we received.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels and staff in the world!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We actually arrived earlier at 5.30am and our bags were brought in and we where checked in by Mr Timmy Tao (Assistant Manager) who advised that as our suite was not ready the hotel had put a smaller room aside for us to use that morning to have a sleep and freshen up in and when we had woken up they would transfer our bags to our suite later in the day.
reviews.title: A true six star hotel
First Class Hotel
reviews.text: We had also asked if possible for a late check out ont he day we were to depart as our flight did not depart until 9.00 pm. This was also accomodated and in fact when we got back into the room that afternoon to shower and change before leaving for the airport, housekeeping had been in and done the room, even thought we were checking out (we had had late checkouts in other hotels before, mostly Sofitels but in all cases Housekeeping had not done the room - another luxury touch - but to be honest I had had a bet with my husband that the service at the hotel was so exceptional that I would not have been suprised to find that housekeeping would have been in).

If i've had to resume St Regis Singapore, i would say immediatly "incredible service"... We arrived very late from Bali and we have been absolutely impressed by the level of service provided by an excellent, so courteous and elegant staff.
reviews.title: Amazing service...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionnist we met for the check in was very smily and he understood we needed a quick and efficient check in. He escorted us in our room, a very huge Lady Astor room, where a complimentary bottle of wine waited for us to celebrate the birthday of my parents... A very nice gesture... Then, after a quick explanation of the facilities, this excellent employee wished us a great night and the butler, discreet and very nice, came to introduce himself and asked us if we needed a tea or anything else. This is just what i called "unparalleled service"... Just for this reason, staying at St Regis Singapore is a real pleasure.
reviews.title: what a disappointing stay - nothing compared to St Regis Bali

reviews.text: But there are some other advantages at St Regis Singapore and first of all the location in a residential area full of trees and at walking distance from the botanical gardens or from Orchard Rd if you're a shopping addict. The area is truly relaxing and much better than the busy business area of Marina Bay for example.
reviews.title: Excellent staycation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then, we can talk about the exceptionnal buffet breakfast, delicious with an extensive selection of dishes from all over the world. You can have everything you want but i highly recommend the waffles, the best i've had in the world. Also, having such a nice and professional staff at the breakfast in the nicest of all the wake up and especially because before to go to the restaurant for breakfast, you can call your butler to have a fresh cappucino or a Tea Latte as complimentary... Much more luxury than a coffee machine in the room...
reviews.title: Breath-taking! 6 stars service with a heart!

reviews.text: And there is the comfort with huge and deep beds, a very luxurious bathroom with a TV in front of the bathroom and a multi-massage shower and you'll find in the bedroom a sofa full of pillows which is truly hard to leave.
reviews.title: A Cut Above!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our Executive Delux Room is luxurious. The bathroom is the best I've ever seen, with a freestanding deep soaking bath, separate shower with jet massage, a separate toilet, and the Remede Spa toiletries. You can find all the five star amenities and facilities in the room, such as bed side control panels, bathrobes and slippers, a decent walk-in-robe, and of course, a dedicated butler. There's complimentary specialty coffee and tea which the butlet will bring over at any time of the day. The Remede Spa in the hotel is absolutely fabulous. There's a large steam chamber, sauna, whirl pool, spa garden, and ice fountain. The spa treatment I had, however, was a bit disappointing and expensive in Asian standard, and the treatment felt a bit rushed. There is also a good outdoor swimming pool. We walked from the hotel to Orchard Road everyday, which took about 15-20 min. Overall, St Regis Singapore is an excellent hotel and we had a beautiful stay.
reviews.title: Luxurious stay in Singapore

reviews.text: Classy with very helpful staff. I arrived early and they offered me a seat in the breakfast room with internet and a lovely coffee, but check in was a piece of cake and check out just as easy. Nice rooms, but a bit of an odd layout...with the elevators in the middle and gangplank walk ways to the rooms. The breakfast rooms were really cold (too much A/C). The guest rooms were well appointed with good in-room internet, a nice "spa" feel and upper level rooms have a great view of the city and parks surrounding Tanglin Rd and Orchard Rd. Again, the A/C was hard to regulate and the beds were a bit hard. With some down time, I asked the concierge for ideas for tours and they came up with several options so I could choose what to do and how to best use my time. Everyone was very helpful. I fell sick (briefly) while I was there and the staff was helpful, discreet, sympathetic and efficient. It is a bit of a walk to the main shopping area of Orchard Rd which was fine for me - I like to walk and the taxi services were easy. But the St. Regis is some distance from cultural/sightseeing so you have to pay and plan ahead if you want to do more than shopping. Overall it felt like the lap of luxury, largely thanks to the remarkable staff.
reviews.title: One of the Great Hotels in Singapore

reviews.text: The St Regis Singapore is the creme de la creme of classic hotel luxury. It made my recent business trip to Singapore a uniquely memorable travel and hospitality experience. The opulence, service, location and overall style of the hotel are impeccable. No expense has been spared on any of the details - it is a triumph of both style and substance. During my brief stay I was treated with an in-room white leaf tea service on arrival (inc. complementary suit press and shoe shine), I lounged on the resort-class open air pool deck, marvelled at the in-room luxuries and ate and drank like a king. The central location is also within easy taxi reach of the fabulously atmospheric Dempsey restaurant and bar precinct in a lush jungle setting. The St Regis magically turned what started as a mere business trip into a wonderful experience of luxury pleasure.
reviews.title: The creme de la creme

reviews.title: St. Regis Singapore - fantastic hotel

aka: The St. Regis Singapore Hotel Singapore
description: Superbly located in the heart of prestigious downtown, the St. Regis is Singapore's most eminent address, where unsurpassed luxury resides. A gleaming landmark of exquisite ambiance, the hotel houses one of Asia's finest private art collections. Experience our legendary service as St. Regis Butlers delight in meeting your individual needs around the clock. Enjoy flawless service by our impeccable staff when wining at Decanter, dining at YanTing or relaxing at the Remède Spa.
